string-array.name: commands_array
string-array.item: alias!set or show shell aliases![-p] [name[=value] ...]
at!Execute at later time![−m] time [date] [+incr]!−m = send mail after completion

atop!Advanced system/process monitor!
atop −w file
atop −r [file]!−w = write compressed binary file
−r = read compressed binary file
basename!Last portion of path name!string [suffix]!suffix: to delete from end of string

bash!Bourne-Again shell![−c string] [−inuvx] [arg]...!−c = execute command(s) in string
−i = interactive mode
−n = syntax check only
−u = undefined variables are fatal
−v = show commands as read
−x = trace executed commands
bc!Arithmetic language![−cl] [file]...!−c = compile only\n−l = load math library
bg!Put job in background![%jobid]!jobid as returned by command \'jobs\'
bunzip2!Expand compressed data![file]...

bzip2!Compress data![−cdv123456789] [file]...!−c = send output to stdout
−d = decompress
−v = verbose
−[1-9] = compression level (1=modest, 9=optimal)
cal!Show calendar![[month] year]
cancel!Cancel print request![id]... [printer]...!id = request id of print-job to be deleted\npr = delete current job on printer

cat!Concatenate and print![−enstuv] [file]...!−e = show $ at end of line
−n = number lines
−s = do not report non-existent files
−t = show tabs as ˆI
−u = unbuffered output
−v = show non-printing characters visibly
cd!Change working directory![−P] [directory]\ncd −!− = return to previous directory\n−P = use physical path (interpret symlinks)
chgrp!Change group of file![−R] group file...!−R = process files and directories recursively

chmod!Change file permissions![−R] mode[,mode...] file...!−R = process files and directories recursively


mode: [ugoa]+|-|=[rwxst]
	or
mode: octalvalue, formed by adding
	4000 (setuid)
	2000 (setgid)
	1000 (sticky bit)
	0i00 (owner permission)
	00i0 (group permission)
	000i (others permission)

Values for i are the sum of:
	4 (read)
	2 (write)
	1 (execute)
chown!Change owner of file![−hR] user[:group] file...!−h = change owner of symlink\n−R = process files and directories recursively
clear!Clear the terminal screen

cmp!Compare two files![−ls] file1 file2!−l = show byte number and differing bytes
−s = show nothing

One file argument can be − for standard input
cp!Copy file![−ipr] file... target!−i = interactive\n−p = preserve mode\n−r = process files and directories recursively

cpio!Copy files to and from archive!−i[dmtuv] [−C n] [−H odc] ...
cpio −o[aLv] [−C n] [−H odc]
cpio −p[admuv] directory!−i = copy in
−o = copy out
−p = copy pass
−a = reset access times of input files
−C = do I/O in blocks of n bytes
−d = create directories as needed
−H odc = use POSIX headers
−L = follow symbolic links
−m = get file modification time from archive
−t = show table of contents
−u = copy unconditionally
−v = verbose
crontab!Maintain user crontab![−elr] [file]!−e = edit current crontab file\n−l = list current crontab file\n−r = remove current crontab file
cupsdisable!stop printers![-c] [-r reason] printer ...!-c = cancels all jobs\-r = associate a reason
cupsenable!start printers!printer ...

cut!Cut out fields of line!−c list [file]...
cut −f list [−d char] [−s] [file]...!−c = list specifies character positions
−d = char is field delimiter
−f = list specifies field positions
−s = suppress lines with no field delimiters
List is a comma-separated enumeration of requested fields

date!Show/set the date![+format]
date mmddHHMM[CC]YY!format = output format string with text and fields.

Fields:
%a = name of weekday
%d = day
%D = mm/dd/yy
%h = name of month
%H = hour
%j = day of year
%m = month
%M = minute
%n = newline
%r = as %T with AM/PM notation
%S = second
%t = tab
%T = hh:mm:ss
%w = day of week
%Y = year
%% = literal %

dd!Convert and copy a file![option=value]!bs= block size
count= copy n input records only
ibs= input block size
if= input file
of= output file
obs= output block size
seek= skip n output records
skip= skip n input records
df!Show mounted filesystems![−khl]!−k = sizes in KiB\n−h = sizes human readable\n−l = local filesystems only

diff!Differential file comparator![−beh] [−C n] file1 file2!−b = ignore trailing blanks
−C = give n lines of context
−e = produce edit script
−h = fast but half-hearted
One file argument can be − for standard input
dirname!First portion of path name!string

du!Show disk usage![−akhrs] [directory]...!−a = give usage for each file
−k = sizes in Kbytes
−h = sizes human-readable
−r = report unreadable directories and files
−s = give grand total only
echo!Echo arguments![argument]...
env!Environment variables![name=val]... [cmd [arg]...]]
export!Export variable to child processes!shellvar[=value]
expr!Evaluate arguments as expression!values/operators!Operators can be ( ) + - * / %
fg!Get job to foreground![%jobid]!jobid as returned by command \'jobs\'
file!Determine file type![−f ffile] [file]...!−f = take names of files from ffile

find!Find files![path]... [matchexpr]...!−atime n = last access time n days ago (same for −ctime/−mtime)
−depth = do depth search
−size n = size in blocks
−size n[kMG] = size in bytes/KiB/MiB/GiB
−type c = file type c (bcdflp)
−user uname = username or numeric uid
−xdev = do not cross mount points
−exec cmd \;
−ok cmd \;
−print = print name of matched file

grep!Search files for pattern (regexp)![−bchilnqsv] regexp [file]...!−b = show byte number
−c = show only count of matching lines
−e = next argument is regexp
−h = suppress file names in output
−i = ignore upper/lower case distinction
−l = list names of files with matching lines
−n = show line number for matching lines
−q = quit (no output to stdout)
−s = suppress error messages
−v = show all lines except those that match

See separate TAB for regular expressions
gunzip!Expand compressed data![−cv] [−S suffix] [file]...!−c = send output to stdout\n−S = use suffix instead of .gz\n−v = verbose

gzip!Compress data![−cdv123456789] [−S suffix] [file]...!−c = send output to stdout
−d = decompress
−S = use suffix instead of .gz
−v = verbose
−[1-9] = compression level (1=modest, 9=optimal)
head!Show first 10 lines![−N|−n N] [file]...!N = show first N lines only
hexdump!Hexadecimal dump![−C] [file]...!−C = canonical hex+ASCII display
id!Show user and group IDs!
jobs!Show all jobs in current session![−ln] [%jobid]...!−l = list PIDs in addition to normal info\n−n = list stopped or exited processes only

kill!Send signal to process![−sig|−s sig] pid...
kill [−sig|−s sig] %jobid...!Sig can be e.g.

	HUP = hangup (1)
	INT = interrupt (2)
	QUIT = quit (3)
	KILL = kill (9)
	TERM = terminate (15)
	STOP = freeze
	USR1 = user defined 1
	USR2 = user defined 2
less!Browse through text files![file]...
let!Evaluate arithmetic expressions!arg [arg]...!arg = arithmetic expression
ln!Link files![−fs] file... target!−f = no question when target not writable\n−s = create symbolic link
logname!Get login name!

lp!Send request to printer![−c] [−ddest] [−nnumber] [−s] [−w] [file]...!−c = copy files instead of linking
−d = choose dest as destination printer
−n = print number copies
−s = suppress messages
−w = write message after printing
lpq!Query print job status![−l] [−P dest] [job#]...!−l = list in long format\n−P = query printer dest

lpr!Send request to printer![−P dest] [−#number] [−sT] [file]...!−P = choose dest as destination printer
−# = print number copies
−s = use symlinks instead of copying files
−T = print title on banner page
lprm!Cancel print request![−P dest] [−] [job#]...!−P = remove job for printer dest\n− = remove all jobs of current user
lpstat!Show printer status![−t]!−t = print all status information

ls!List contents of directory![−acdhilLrRstu1] [file|dir]...!−a = all names, also that begin with a period
−c = use time last inode change
−d = list name of directories (not contents)
−h = show size human-readable
−i = print inode number
−l = long format
−L = follow symbolic links
−r = reverse order of sort
−R = recursively list subdirectories
−s = show size in blocks
−t = sort by time
−u = use time last accessed
−1 = single-column output

mail!Send or read mail![−epqr] [−f file]
mail [−t] person...!−e = no printing of mail, only exit code
−f = use file as mail file
−p = print all mail without prompting
−q = terminate after interrupt
−r = print mail in first-in first-out order
−t = precede message by addressed persons

man!Show manual entries![section] title...!Section can be:
1 - user commands
2 - system calls
3 - library functions
4 - device drivers and protocols
5 - file formats
6 - games
7 - peripherals
8 - system administration commands
9 - kernel interfaces
mkdir!Make directory![−p] dirname...!−p = create intermediate non-existing directories

more!Browse through text files![−cf] [−lin] [+lnum] [+/ pattern] [file]...!−c = clear screen before displaying page
−f = do not split lines longer than screen width
−lin = window size is lin lines
+lnum = start at line lnum
+/ pattern = start two lines before pattern
mv!Move file![−fi] file... target!−f = no questions when target not writable\n−i = interactive
nice!Run command at other prio![−incr|−n incr] command [argument]...!incr: higher increment is lower priority
nl!Line numbering![−ba] [−i incr] [−v start#] [file]...!−ba = number empty lines as well\n−i = increment value of line number\n−v = initial line number
nohup!Run command immune to HUP signals!command [argument]...

od!Octal dump![−bcdosx] [file]!−b = bytes in octal
−c = bytes in ASCII
−d = 16-bit words in unsigned decimal
−o = 16-bit words in octal
−s = 16-bit words in signed decimal
−x = 16-bit words in hex
paste!Merge lines of files![-d list] [-s]!-d = reuse characters in list as delimiters\n-s = paste one file at a time
passwd!Change login password![username]

pr!Format data![−ad] [−h head] [−l n] [−o n] [−w n] [+page] [−cols] [file]...!−a = multi-column across page
−d = double-space output
−h = next argument is header
−l = page length is n
−o = offset on output is n
−wn = line width is n
+page = start with page
−cols = produce cols column output

ps!Show process status![−efl] [ −p pidlist ] [−t ttylist] [−u uidlist]!−e = all processes
−f = full listing
−l = long listing
−p = list processes with PID in pidlist only
−t = list processes with tty in ttylist only
−u = list processes with UID/name in uidlist only
pwd!Show working directory![−P]!−P = report physical path, not via symlinks
renice!Change prio of running process![−n] prio [−p] pid...!−n = set absolute priority (flag may be omitted)\n−p = pid (flag may be omitted)
rm!Remove file![−fir] file...!−f = don’t ask questions\n−i = interactive\n−r = recursively delete directories and contents
rmdir!Remove empty directory!dir...

scp!Secure remote file copy![−Cr] file... target!−C = use compression
−r = process files and directories recursively

File(s) and target are either
 [user@]hostname:path or path
script!Trace terminal session![−a] [logfile]!−a = append instead of overwrite

sdiff!Side-by-side difference![−ls] [−o result] [−w width] file1 file2!−l = only show left side of identical lines
−o = use result as output file
−s = don’t print identical lines
−w = use width as width of output

sed!Stream editor![−ni] [−e] subcmd [file]...
sed [−ni] −f cmdfile [file]...!−e = execute commands
−f = take commands from cmdfile
−i = in-place modification
−n = no default printing of lines
sleep!Suspend execution for interval!seconds

sort!Sort and/or merge files![−bcdfmnru] [−k pos1[,pos2]...] [−o outfile] [−t c] [file]...!−b = ignore leading whitespace
−c = check if input is sorted
−d = dictionary order
−f = treat lower case as upper case
−k = use field pos1 through pos2 as sort key
−m = merge already sorted files
−n = numeric sort
−o = use outfile as output file
−r = reverse order
−t = use c as field separator
−u = unique (output one if sort key identical)

split!Split file into pieces![−a len] [−l linecnt] [file [result]]!−a = output file suffix length is len
−l = split into linecnt-line pieces

use result as basename for output files
ssh!Secure remote execution![−nv] [user@]host [cmd [arg...]]!−n = redirect stdin to /dev/null\n−v = verbose mode
stop!Suspend a job!%jobid!jobid as returned by command \'jobs\'
strings!Printable strings in binary file![−a] [−o] [file]...!−a = examine complete file\n−o = precede each string by its offset in file
stty!Get/set terminal settings![−ag] [settings]!−a = report all settings\n−g = report valid arguments
su!Switch to another user![−] [username [arg...]]!− = change environment to login environment
sudo!execute a command as another user![-u user] [-s] [command]!-u user = run command as user\n-s = run command using a shell or start an interactive shell when no command is given

systemctl!Control the systemd system and service manager![option]... command [name]...!Commands

	get-default = default target to boot into
	set-default <target> = set default target to boot into
	list-units = list known units
	isolate <target> = switch to target
	start <unit>... = start one or more units
	stop <unit>... = stop on or more units
	enable <unit>... = add one or more units to the running target
	disable <unit>... = add one or more units to the running target
tac!Concatenate and print in reverse![file]...

tail!Show last 10 lines![−n ±N|−c ±N] [−f [−s delay]] [file]!−c = last N bytes (-N) or from byte N onwards (+N)
−n = last N lines (-N) or from line N onwards (+N)
−f = follow end of file
−s = probing delay (seconds) when following
talk!Talk to another user!user[@host] [ttyname]

tar!File archiver!−c|r[jvz][f file] [file|dir]...
tar −t[v][f file] [file]...
tar −x[v][f file] [file]...!−c = create new archive
−f = file is archive
−r = write at end of archive
−j = bzip2 compression
−t = list files in archive
−v = verbose
−x = extract files from archive
−z = gzip compression
tee!Pass stdin/stdout and write to file![−ai] [file]...!−a = append to file(s)\n−i = ignore interrupt signals
telnet!Remote login (insecure)![host [port]]
test!Condition evaluation!expr\n[ expr ]
time!Time another command!command [arg]...
top!System/process monitor![−d delay]!−d = delay in seconds
touch!Change file stamps (implicit create)![−acm] file...!−a = only change access time\n−c = do not create non-existing file\n−m = only change modification time

tput!Initialize terminal or query terminfo![−T type] capname [parms]...
tput [−T type] −S!−S = read capnames from stdin
−T = terminal type is type

Capname can be:
	clear
	cup line col (cursor positioning)
	home
	init
	longname
	reset
	rmso (normal mode)
	smso (standout mode)
	and many more...
tr!Translate characters![−cds] string1 [string2]!−c = complement characters in string1\n−d = delete input characters in string1\n−s = squeeze repeated char from string2 to one
tty!Get name of terminal![−s]!−s = just exit code (0=terminal, 1=otherwise)
type!Show how command is interpreted!command

typeset!Set attributes/values for variables![±irx] [name[=value]]!−i = integer arithmetic
−r = qualify as read-only
−x = qualify for automatic export

Specifying + instead of − removes a property

umask!Set file creation mask!−S [mode]
umask [octal mode]!−S = show mode in symbolic form

See chmod for modes to be allowed
(or denied when using octal notation)

uname!Show info about system![−amnrsv]!−a = all info
−m = machine name
−n = node name
−r = release
−s = system name
−v = version

uniq!Show/suppress repeated lines![−cdi] [−f N|−s N] [-w N] [infile [outfile]]!−c = prefix output line with counter
−d = only show duplicate lines
−i = ignore upper/lower case distinction
−f N = skip first N fields in each line
−s N = skip first N characters in each line
−w N = do not compare more than N chars
unset!Destroy shell variable![−f] variable/function...!−f = undefine functions
unzip!Extract compressed files from ZIP archive!zipfile[.zip] [file...]

unxz![-kfcl]!−k = keep original file
-f = overwrite existing target file
−c = send output to stdout
-l = show information
vim!Full screen (visual) editor![file]...!See separate TAB

wc!Word count![−clmw] [file]...!−c = count bytes
−l = count lines
−m = count characters
−w = count words
which!Show the full path of a command![-ai]!-a = print all matches\n-i = read aliases from stdin

who!Who is on the system![−bHqrT]
who am i!−b = print date/time of last reboot
−H = print column headings
−q = print names only
−r = print current run level
−T = read/write state of terminal
write!Write to another user!user [tty]

xargs!Construct arglist and execute command![−l linecnt] [−n argcnt] [−ip] [cmd [init-args]]!−i = replace {} in init-args by path name
−l = linecnt input lines per command
−n = argcnt input args per command
−p = prompt for confirmation before execute

xz!Compress data![-cdkl0123456789] [file]...!−c = send output to stdout
−d = decompress
−k = keep original file
−[0-9] = compression level (0=modest, 9=optimal)
zcat!Show compressed files![−f] [file]...!−f = force decompression

zgrep!Search regexp in compressed data![−bchilnqsv] regexp [file]...!−b = show byte number
−c = show only count of matching lines
−e = next argument is regexp
−h = suppress file names in output
−i = ignore upper/lower case distinction
−l = list names of files with matching lines
−n = show line number for matching lines
−q = quit (no output to stdout)
−s = suppress error messages
−v = show all lines except those that match

See separate TAB for regular expressions
zip!Package and compress files![zipfile [file...]]
zless!Like \'less\', but for compressed files![file ...]
zmore!Like \'more\', but for compressed files![file ...]
